tool.name: FeatureFinderMRM
tool.description: Detects two-dimensional features in LC-MS data
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: min_rt_distance
param.label: Minimal distance of MRM features in seconds

param.name: min_num_peaks_per_feature
param.label: Minimal number of peaks which are needed for a single feature

param.name: min_signal_to_noise_ratio
param.label: Minimal S/N ratio a peak must have to be taken into account
param.help: Set to zero if the MRM-traces contains mostly signals, and no noise

param.name: write_debug_files
param.label: If set to true, for each feature a plot will be created, in the subdirectory 'debug'

param.name: resample_traces
param.label: If set to true, each trace, which is in this case a part of the MRM monitoring trace with signal is resampled, using the minimal distance of two data points in RT dimension

param.name: write_debuginfo
param.label: If set to true, debug messages are written, the output can be somewhat lengthy
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Detects two-dimensional features in LC-MS data.
For more information, visit https://openms.de/doxygen/release/3.1.0/html/TOPP_FeatureFinderMRM.html
